cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Initially drifting, then forecast to move NNW toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coast this weekend, turn NE and track just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the border of South Carolina and North Carolina (close to Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire coastline from South Carolina north-eastward to southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds, highest likelihood Tuesday as the system passes offshore; occasional gusty easterlies possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected; any rise likely <2 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers possible Monday–Tuesday with light to moderate accumulations (<2 in).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents could disrupt vessel scheduling and pilot transfers.
